p: While natural infection is able to induce both mucosal and systemic heterosubtypic responses, the immunity induced by parenterally application of inactivated influenza vaccines is generally virus subtype‐specific. 37 In pre‐immunized subjects, the natural contact with the pathogen causes a rapid synthesis of IgA and IgG by B memory cells already 3 days after infection. These immunoglobulins form Ig‐virus complexes which result in virus inactivation. 17
